snippet: The police said they were searching for a man who knew the woman and her three daughters, who were stabbed at a motel used to house homeless families.
abstract: New York City police say they are still searching for Michael Sykes, suspect in killing of Rebecca Cutler and two of her daughters at Staten Island motel, one of 41 hotels used by city to shelter homeless; third daughter, a two-year-old, was wounded critically; killings have thrust city's homeless crisis back in news.

byline.original: By ASHLEY SOUTHALL and MARC SANTORA
byline.contributor: Nikita Stewart and Rebecca White contributed reporting. Doris Burke contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The police said they were searching for a man who knew the woman and her three daughters, who were stabbed at a motel used to house homeless families.

headline.main: Woman and 2 Daughters Fatally Stabbed at Staten Island Motel
headline.print_headline: Woman and 2 Daughters  Fatally Stabbed at Hotel
